main event: A circular, little disc was observed in the sky over Anita, Iowa on 25 October 1956. The object was the size of the head of a pin at arm's length, stationary, and kept flipping over. It was seen visually and through binoculars for two minutes.
interesting points: The UFO was described as a circular, little disc, with the size of the head of a pin at arm's length.
The object was observed visually and through binoculars for two minutes, indicating a prolonged sighting.
It was stationary but kept flipping over, suggesting unusual movement patterns.
The source of the observation was ground-radar, adding technological credibility to the report.
sighted object: circular, little disc in the sky
